page.title: 08Performance practicalities
page.content: Rehersals for the production begin in May. There are 5 island rehersals altogether, with one dress rehersal on the island the weekend before the performance. The actors are drawn from a variety of backgrounds, though it is becoming increasingly difficult to find people willing to donate their free time. A cowshed is used as a changing room and a store room for lighting and effects. The set is a simple composite set, with some arches and rostra provided, and the best is made of natural scenery. Costumes come from the Royal Shakespeare Hire Wardrobe. Actual stage lighting is used- the most expensive part of the organisation.The actual performance lasts around 3 hours, and it takes nearly 40 minutes to clear the island. Refreshments are provided during the half hour interval in a marquee.
